item.description:
Overnight road trip to the Long Island wine region for a tasting extravaganza.

The plan is to gather in Hudson and leave at 8am Sat, Sept 24 to catch the 10am New London ferry to LI which arrives at 11:30am. Most wineries open at 11am. 

I'm still researching hotels and a restaurant for dinner.

Return is 3pm ferry on Sunday, Sept 25. 

Of course, you can make other arrangements.

We can and should car pool to reduce car and ferry costs. A parking garage is available at the ferry. We could also gather in New London and take only a few cars over.

Please sign-up only if you definitely want to attend. 

 

More details:

I suggest each person bring a picnic lunch(for sat and sun), instead of searching for places to eat. This way, we can picnic at a winery, buy wine and also have more time to visit other wineries! Wineries close around 5pm, so we would arrive in Riverhead around 5:30. Check into hotel, drive to restaurant, cocktails, dinner at ~7pm. Leave at 10am Sunday morning, arrive first winery by ~11am(or 10:30).  I need to be home by 7pm so my last winery is Old Fields at 1:45pm, leaving by 2:15 to catch ferry at 3pm. Of course, if we have more than 1 car,  others can catch a later ferry. You could also reserve a later ferry and possibly get stand-by, if you decide to leave earlier. Hotels apparently are in short supply due to many weddings. However, I found a Budget East End in Riverhead for $129. Its located at 30 East Moriches Road, Riverhead, NY. They have a 48 hour cancellation policy. I'll search for restaurants and offer a few suggestions for consideration.  Mostly using TripAdvisor:  http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurants-g48502-Riverhead_Long_Island_New_York.html I'm making a ferry reservation for myself and 1 car. I can take 3 people comfortably (and I'm not drinking). So if you're taking your car, you'll need to do make reservations.    The drivers need to know who is car pooling, so they can add the passengers to their reservation. You can also make a reservation just as a passenger.  https://www.longislandferry.com/Reservation/Departure.aspx ** This is a fair weather trip **  That is, the weather should be mostly fair. But if the forecast is rain all weekend, its not much fun. You'll need $$ for wine tastings. Here's a map of the LI wineries. http://www.liwines.com/   and http://www.liwineguide.com/ Please let me know if you have any questions. I've traveled this route often and can probably answer any questions.
